The Schertz/Seguin Local Government Corporation will own and operate a groundwater treatment plant in rural Gonzales County, Texas. The Corporation is aware of its obligations under section 112r of the Clean Air Act. The Corporation notes that there are two obligations that are required of the water treatment plant.



112r(1) - Purpose and General Duty Clause:

The substance of the general duty clause is that the Owner/Operator that stores and uses hazardous chemicals in any quantity has an obligation to ensure safe operation and to have a plan in the event of an accident. The Corporation will develop plans to prevent and implement steps to respond to an emergency situation.



Risk Management Plan:

These EPA Risk Management Plan (RMP)support documents satisfy the requirements of 40 CFR 68.  The WTP accidental release prevention policy involves an approach that integrates technologies, procedures, and management practices.  The WTP facility adheres to all applicable procedures of the federal EPA Risk Management Program (EPA-RMP).  The emergency response policy involves the preparation of response plan, which are tailored to this facility and to the emergency response of the community and local responding agencies.  It is tin compliance with the EPA Emergency Response Program requirements.  



Accidental release prevention program (ARP) is in compliance with the federal Process Safety Management (PSM) rule and is based on the following elements:

- High level training for plant operators

- Preventative maintenance program

- Use of state of the are process and safety equipment to control any accidental releases of chlorine

- Use of an accurate and effective written operating procedure through participation of the operators

- Performance hazard review of equipment and procedures

- Assignment of facility superintendent with overall responsibility for the RMP
